intro: Trichilia pugana, commonly known as the African sandalwood, is a small to medium-sized tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes species known for their aromatic wood. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that appear in clusters. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release flat, winged seeds. Trichilia pugana is often found in moist, well-drained soils in forested areas.
